meanings.definition: A work of art consisting of three panels, typically hinged together.
meanings.sent1: The artist painted a beautiful triptych featuring a landscape on each panel.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a stunning triptych by a famous painter.
meanings.sent3: At the art show, the triptych of three cats playing instruments brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her life was like a triptych, with each phase representing a different chapter of her journey.
meanings.sent5: The triptych of colorful flowers seemed to jump out of the canvas, captivating all who passed by.

meanings.definition: A set of three associated artistic, literary, or musical works intended to be appreciated together.
meanings.sent1: The author published a triptych of novels that followed the adventures of the same character.
meanings.sent2: The composer created a musical triptych that combined elements of classical and modern music.
meanings.sent3: The triptych of short stories intertwined seamlessly, creating a delightful reading experience.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a triptych, with each friend complementing the others perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The triptych of poems painted vivid images in the minds of the readers, leaving a lasting impression.
